snippet: Many people wait until they become ill or need medical services to sign up under the Affordable Care Act, driving up costs broadly, insurers have told federal health officials.
abstract: Health insurance providers and state officials are complaining that Obama administration's willingness to allow significant numbers of people to sign up late for coverage under Affordable Care Act has exacted financial toll; say special enrollment categories, of which there are more than 30, have allowed people to delay enrollment until they become ill, raising costs.
lead_paragraph: Many people wait until they become ill or need medical services to sign up under the Affordable Care Act, driving up costs broadly, insurers have told federal health officials.

headline.main: Insurers Say Costs Are Climbing as More Enroll Past Health Act Deadline
headline.print_headline: Insurers Say Costs Are Climbing as More Enroll Past Health Act Deadline

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
